Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black with part of lotus flower in added white outline; exterior: uncertain painted decoration.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The exterior and interior surfaces of the sherd were burnt during the bombings in London in 1941. The interior decoration is consistent with the Mature Animal and later styles but the exterior decoration, which is unclear, is unlikely to be as late as the Chalice style when decoration is not extensive.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0582) (phase 2)
